cards.flavor:
"The darkness crawls with vampires and ghouls, but we are not without allies."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch
cards.name: Abbey Griffin
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.flavor: She endures without Avacyn but secretly asks each soul she guides if it has seen her.
cards.name: Angel of Flight Alabaster
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target Spirit card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: From mortal hope immortal power springs.
cards.name: Angelic Overseer
cards.text:
Flying
As long as you control a Human, Angelic Overseer has hexproof and indestructible.

cards.flavor: Moorlanders speak in awe of the priests' talent for arriving just in time to drive off the wicked things that prowl the ravished parish.
cards.name: Avacynian Priest
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target non-Human creature.

cards.flavor:
"What cannot be destroyed will be bound."
—Oath of Avacyn
cards.name: Bonds of Faith
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's a Human. Otherwise, it can't attack or block.

cards.flavor: "I stand for every cobbler, tanner, and fool in this town—and they stand for me."
cards.name: Champion of the Parish
cards.text: Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of the Parish.

cards.flavor: Death has bound it with chains of past regrets. Forever it searches for atonement, each kindness removing a single link.
cards.name: Chapel Geist
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor:
"I heard her talking in her sleep—pleading, shrieking, snarling. It was not my daughter's voice. That is not my daughter."
—Ekatrin, elder of Hanweir
cards.name: Cloistered Youth
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may transform Cloistered Youth.

cards.flavor: The fiend tormented them by recounting the girl's memories, as if some part of her remained inside that twisted shell.
cards.name: Unholy Fiend
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, you lose 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"Never forget our ancestors. They have not forgotten us."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch
cards.name: Dearly Departed
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Dearly Departed is in your graveyard, each Human creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: Survival of the purest.
cards.name: Divine Reckoning
cards.text:
Each player chooses a creature he or she controls. Destroy the rest.
Flashback {5}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.
cards.name: Doomed Traveler
cards.text: When Doomed Traveler dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "My greatest hope is that you will surpass me in every way, consigning my name to some forgotten corner of history."
cards.name: Elder Cathar
cards.text: When Elder Cathar dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. If that creature is a Human, put two +1/+1 counters on it instead.

cards.flavor: "No matter how many I kill, there are always more to hunt. It makes me smile just to think about it."
cards.name: Elite Inquisitor
cards.text:
First strike, vigilance
Protection from Vampires, from Werewolves, and from Zombies

cards.flavor: People only say "I'm sure it was nothing" when they're sure it was something.
cards.name: Feeling of Dread
cards.text:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Flashback {1}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Fiend Hunter
cards.text:
When Fiend Hunter enters the battlefield, you may exile another target creature.
When Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor: The spirit cares nothing for the crimes or triumphs of the slain. It shelters all beneath its stormy cloak.
cards.name: Gallows Warden
cards.text:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +0/+1.

cards.name: Geist-Honored Monk
cards.text:
Vigilance
Geist-Honored Monk's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
When Geist-Honored Monk enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Ghostly Possession
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

cards.flavor: In life, they were a motley crew: farmers, lords, cutpurses, priests. In death, they are united in singular, benevolent purpose.
cards.name: Intangible Virtue
cards.text: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.

cards.flavor: "Ghoulcallers trying to get in, geists trying to get out . . . . This duty is never dull."
cards.name: Mausoleum Guard
cards.text: When Mausoleum Guard dies, put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."
cards.name: Mentor of the Meek
cards.text: Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: The path back to the world of the living is murky and bewildering. A geist may not even realize that it's terrifying its own loved ones.
cards.name: Midnight Haunting
cards.text: Put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Mikaeus, the Lunarch
cards.text:
Mikaeus, the Lunarch enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mikaeus.
{T}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Mikaeus: Put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control.

cards.flavor: "My faith is stronger than fang, claw, or mindless hunger."
cards.name: Moment of Heroism
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: "By the law of Avacyn, the following thoughts, words, and deeds are henceforth disallowed."
cards.name: Nevermore
cards.text:
As Nevermore enters the battlefield, name a nonland card.
The named card can't be cast.

cards.flavor:
"Moonlight has a way of showing all things as they truly are—for better or for worse."
—Zilla of Lambholt
cards.name: Paraselene
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 1 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.

cards.flavor: Some priests speak in whispers of the Helvault, a silver prison of unpurged evils.
cards.name: Purify the Grave
cards.text:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Flashback {W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor:
"If you must go out at night, bring a mob."
—Master of the Elgaud Cathars
cards.name: Rally the Peasants
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor:
"No one chooses to be stitched together into a skaab. If it could speak, it would beg for its own destruction."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
cards.name: Rebuke
cards.text: Destroy target attacking creature.

cards.flavor: "If I fail to offer myself, we will surely be overrun. My fate would be the same."
cards.name: Selfless Cathar
cards.text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Selfless Cathar: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Be careful in your hunt. The clever little creature can steal your wards and lead you right into the werewolf's den."
—Britta, midwife of Gatstaf
cards.name: Silverchase Fox
cards.text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Silverchase Fox: Exile target enchantment.

cards.flavor: You don't want to see his trophy room.
cards.name: Slayer of the Wicked
cards.text: When Slayer of the Wicked enters the battlefield, you may destroy target Vampire, Werewolf, or Zombie.

cards.flavor: Though the old holy wards and roadside shrines have begun to fail, faith in Avacyn still holds true power.
cards.name: Smite the Monstrous
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.

cards.flavor:
"As long as we can utter a prayer or lift a weapon, we have the power to fight back."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
cards.name: Spare from Evil
cards.text: Creatures you control gain protection from non-Human creatures until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Never a word. Never a warning. Only the sound of hoofbeats along the crossways, and the screams of the avenged.
cards.name: Spectral Rider
cards.text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.flavor:
Let moss grow over gargoyles
—Gavony saying meaning
"forget painful memories"
cards.name: Stony Silence
cards.text: Activated abilities of artifacts can't be activated.

cards.flavor:
"I've learned to trust my dogs' instincts. When they're calm, I'm calm. And when they get nervous, I get my crossbow."
—Hinrik of House Cecani
cards.name: Thraben Purebloods

cards.flavor: "Looks like it's going to be a quiet night."
cards.name: Thraben Sentry
cards.text:
Vigilance
Whenever another creature you control dies, you may transform Thraben Sentry.

cards.flavor: "The time for grief is over. The time for retribution has begun."
cards.name: Thraben Militia
cards.text: Trample

cards.flavor:
"Who says werewolves are the only ones who can hunt as a pack?"
—Kolman, elder of Gatstaf
cards.name: Unruly Mob
cards.text: Whenever another creature you control dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Unruly Mob.

cards.flavor:
"To show geists pity is to prolong their agonies. Whether they know it or not, they seek the Blessed Sleep, and we are to give it to them."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch
cards.name: Urgent Exorcism
cards.text: Destroy target Spirit or enchantment.

cards.flavor: "Priests, hunters, slayers—to arms! The enemy approaches!"
cards.name: Village Bell-Ringer
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Village Bell-Ringer enters the battlefield, untap all creatures you control.

cards.flavor:
"I'd rather take on a neckbiter or moonhowler any day. Oh well, looks like I'm going to end up parrying with empty air half the night."
—Saint Trogen, the Slayer
cards.name: Voiceless Spirit
cards.text: Flying, first strike

cards.flavor: Literally made for battle.
cards.name: Armored Skaab
cards.text: When Armored Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: On Innistrad, death is just a career change.
cards.name: Back from the Brink
cards.text: Exile a creature card from your graveyard and pay its mana cost: Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.flavor: Not content to nudge vases and chill drawing rooms, some geists muster spectral armies to claw at the hearts of the living.
cards.name: Battleground Geist
cards.text:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Cackling Counterpart
cards.text:
Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of target creature you control.
Flashback {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: "Me, angry? Of course not. Thanks to my research, I'm above such petty emotions now."
cards.name: Civilized Scholar
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card. If a creature card is discarded this way, untap Civilized Scholar, then transform it.

cards.flavor: For a moment his basest desires run free, unshackled by reason or conscience.
cards.name: Homicidal Brute
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if Homicidal Brute didn't attack this turn, tap Homicidal Brute, then transform it.

cards.flavor: Six feet of earth muffled his cries.
cards.name: Claustrophobia
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Claustrophobia enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.flavor: "Surely you know the joy of the hunt, my furry friend. My kind of hunt just takes a different form than yours."
cards.name: Curiosity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: After seeing his life's work drip away, the mage decided it was a good time to go crazy.
cards.name: Curse of the Bloody Tome
cards.text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Delver of Secrets
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may reveal that card. If an instant or sorcery card is revealed this way, transform Delver of Secrets.

cards.flavor:
"Unfortunately, all my test animals have died or escaped, so I shall be the final subject. I feel no fear. This is a momentous night."
—Laboratory notes, final entry
cards.name: Insectile Aberration
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: "Garl, adjust the slurry dispensers. Garl, fetch more corpses. Garl, quit crying and give me your brain tissue. If he doesn't stop being so rude, I'm quitting."
cards.name: Deranged Assistant
cards.text: {T}, Put the top card of your library into your graveyard: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"This abomination never belonged in our world. I'm merely setting it free."
—Dierk, geistmage
cards.name: Dissipate
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Dream Twist
cards.text:
Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Flashback {1}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Forbidden Alchemy
cards.text:
Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Flashback {6}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: Unbreakable and unappetizing, the crab grows uninterrupted, sometimes to the size of a cottage and beyond.
cards.name: Fortress Crab

cards.flavor: Whether he actually exists is in question, but the terror she feels is excruciatingly real.
cards.name: Frightful Delusion
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}. That player discards a card.

cards.name: Grasp of Phantoms
cards.text:
Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
Flashback {7}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor:
"The panic is amusing, but the real fun comes when the spell passes and the villagers start looking for a scapegoat."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
cards.name: Hysterical Blindness
cards.text: Creatures your opponents control get -4/-0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "All that concerns me is the vampires' sense of smell and those freezing Nephalian nights."
cards.name: Invisible Stalker
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Invisible Stalker can't be blocked.

cards.flavor: His mind whirled with grand plans, never thinking of what might happen if he were to succeed.
cards.name: Laboratory Maniac
cards.text: If you would draw a card while your library has no cards in it, you win the game instead.

cards.flavor: Bound to the square where she died, she calls out to those in danger—usually scaring them straight into the peril she warns of.
cards.name: Lantern Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Return Lantern Spirit to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: The secrets she carried could have saved many lives, but they quietly drowned with her.
cards.name: Lost in the Mist
cards.text: Counter target spell. Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Ludevic's Test Subject
cards.text:
Defender
{1}{U}: Put a hatchling counter on Ludevic's Test Subject. Then if there are five or more hatchling counters on it, remove all of them and transform it.

cards.flavor: After several frustrating experiments, the visionary Ludevic realized he needed to create a monster that fed on torch-wielding mobs.
cards.name: Ludevic's Abomination
cards.text: Trample

cards.flavor:
"It always amazes me what perfectly good things people throw away."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
cards.name: Makeshift Mauler
cards.text: As an additional cost to cast Makeshift Mauler, exile a creature card from your graveyard.

cards.name: Memory's Journey
cards.text:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Mindshrieker
cards.text:
Flying
{2}: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Mindshrieker gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that card's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Mirror-Mad Phantasm
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{U}: Mirror-Mad Phantasm's owner shuffles it into his or her library. If that player does, he or she reveals cards from the top of that library until a card named Mirror-Mad Phantasm is revealed. The player puts that card onto the battlefield and all other cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor: The heron is the symbol of the archangel Avacyn. The fact that such spirits still fly gives the church hope that its founder may one day return.
cards.name: Moon Heron
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: Even more than carrion, they crave the last words of the dying.
cards.name: Murder of Crows
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever another creature dies, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

cards.flavor:
"Let those idiot priests tremble! A new era in unlife begins here and now. Oglor, raise the lightning vane!"
—Stitcher Geralf
cards.name: Rooftop Storm
cards.text: You may pay {0} rather than pay the mana cost for Zombie creature spells you cast.

cards.flavor: "What some call obsession, I call the quest for perfection."
cards.name: Runic Repetition
cards.text: Return target exiled card with flashback you own to your hand.

cards.flavor: "The mist whispers to those who know it to be more than a mundane fog."
cards.name: Selhoff Occultist
cards.text: Whenever Selhoff Occultist or another creature dies, target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor: They call it "stitcher's anesthesia," a spell to deaden the senses while the mad doctors begin their grisly work.
cards.name: Sensory Deprivation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.

cards.flavor: The same magic that lets geists pass through our realm can force them out of it.
cards.name: Silent Departure
cards.text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Flashback {4}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor:
"Three heads, six arms, and some armor grafts are better than . . . the normal numbers of those things."
—Stitcher Geralf
cards.name: Skaab Goliath
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Skaab Goliath, exile two creature cards from your graveyard.
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)

cards.name: Skaab Ruinator
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Skaab Ruinator, exile three creature cards from your graveyard.
Flying
You may cast Skaab Ruinator from your graveyard.

cards.name: Snapcaster Mage
cards.text:
Flash
When Snapcaster Mage enters the battlefield, target instant or sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost. (You may cast that card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor:
"The church looks down on binding spirits into armor, but now I can look down on them."
—Dierk, geistmage
cards.name: Spectral Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.

cards.flavor:
"The best skaab are more powerful and more beautiful than the sum of their parts."
—Stitcher Geralf
cards.name: Stitched Drake
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Stitched Drake, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Flying

cards.flavor: "Oglor create life, Oglor take it away. Oglor god! . . . until Master return."
cards.name: Stitcher's Apprentice
cards.text: {1}{U}, {T}: Put a 2/2 blue Homunculus creature token onto the battlefield, then sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Sturmgeist
cards.text:
Flying
Sturmgeist's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
Whenever Sturmgeist deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "Either I know just the spell I need, or I'm about to."
cards.name: Think Twice
cards.text:
Draw a card.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Undead Alchemist
cards.text:
If a Zombie you control would deal combat damage to a player, instead that player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Whenever a creature card is put into an opponent's graveyard from his or her library, exile that card and put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Death took his humanity but not his skill with the knife.
cards.name: Abattoir Ghoul
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Abattoir Ghoul this turn dies, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

cards.flavor:
"The demons don't care if we mutter niceties and act out ceremonies. Just kill him."
—Bishop Volpaig, servant of Griselbrand
cards.name: Altar's Reap
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Altar's Reap, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.

cards.flavor: Sometimes death comes knocking. Sometimes it tears down the walls.
cards.name: Army of the Damned
cards.text:
Put thirteen 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield tapped.
Flashback {7}{B}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Bitterheart Witch
cards.text:
Deathtouch
When Bitterheart Witch dies, you may search your library for a Curse card, put it onto the battlefield attached to target player, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: He relishes the devotion of his Skirsdag puppets and their belief that it will earn them immortality.
cards.name: Bloodgift Demon
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, target player draws a card and loses 1 life.

cards.name: Bloodline Keeper
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Put a 2/2 black Vampire creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
{B}: Transform Bloodline Keeper. Activate this ability only if you control five or more Vampires.

cards.name: Lord of Lineage
cards.text:
Flying
Other Vampire creatures you control get +2/+2.
{T}: Put a 2/2 black Vampire creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Brain Weevil
cards.text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Sacrifice Brain Weevil: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.flavor: It's not just the wind. It's not all in your head. And it's definitely something to worry about.
cards.name: Bump in the Night
cards.text:
Target opponent loses 3 life.
Flashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Corpse Lunge
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Corpse Lunge, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Corpse Lunge deals damage equal to the exiled card's power to target creature.

cards.flavor: "May you and all your kin waste and wither until your clan is no more!"
cards.name: Curse of Death's Hold
cards.text:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls get -1/-1.

cards.flavor: The first step to peace is to learn how to forget.
cards.name: Curse of Oblivion
cards.text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player exiles two cards from his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor: The crueler vampires' idea of free-range farming.
cards.name: Dead Weight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.

cards.flavor:
"At least this one still has arms and legs. Well, most of its legs."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
cards.name: Diregraf Ghoul
cards.text: Diregraf Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor: The demon Griselbrand dared to stand against Avacyn, earning him the loathing of thousands and the admiration of a few.
cards.name: Disciple of Griselbrand
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

cards.flavor: With Thraben's army recalled to its city walls, outlying villages were left to fend for themselves.
cards.name: Endless Ranks of the Dead
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put X 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is half the number of Zombies you control, rounded down.

cards.flavor: "I often think on how excited they must feel to be chosen as my prey."
cards.name: Falkenrath Noble
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Falkenrath Noble or another creature dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"The living are born small and weak. The dead rise ready to serve. The choice is obvious."
—Gisa, ghoulcaller of Gavony
cards.name: Ghoulcaller's Chant
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return two target Zombie cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"Come. Bring your brothers. Tonight, you feast on living flesh."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
cards.name: Ghoulraiser
cards.text: When Ghoulraiser enters the battlefield, return a Zombie card at random from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: She wanted to inspire terror wherever she went. The demons happily granted her wish.
cards.name: Gruesome Deformity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has intimidate. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.flavor:
"They won't be winning any beauty pageants, but they'll do the trick."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
cards.name: Heartless Summoning
cards.text:
Creature spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
Creatures you control get -1/-1.

cards.name: Liliana of the Veil
cards.text:
+1: Each player discards a card.
−2: Target player sacrifices a creature.
−6: Separate all permanents target player controls into two piles. That player sacrifices all permanents in the pile of his or her choice.

cards.flavor: Lungs dried to parchment wheeze blasphemies within a cage of bleached bone.
cards.name: Manor Skeleton
cards.text:
Haste
{1}{B}: Regenerate Manor Skeleton.

cards.flavor: Vampires of the Markov bloodline pride themselves on their exquisite taste in fashion, art, and "wine of the vein."
cards.name: Markov Patrician
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: As the chapel was dragged under, the bell in the tower rang until the murky depths forever silenced its toll.
cards.name: Maw of the Mire
cards.text: Destroy target land. You gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: For a ghoul, every village is a buffet and every disaster is a reunion.
cards.name: Moan of the Unhallowed
cards.text:
Put two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor:
"Let go your grudges, or risk wandering the bogs forever in a murderous rage."
—Hildin, priest of Avacyn
cards.name: Morkrut Banshee
cards.text: Morbid — When Morkrut Banshee enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Innistrad is a place where dreams invade the mind and mere shadows exact a terrible toll.
cards.name: Night Terrors
cards.text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.

cards.flavor: "Avacyn has deserted you. I welcome your devotion in her stead."
cards.name: Reaper from the Abyss
cards.text:
Flying
Morbid — At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, destroy target non-Demon creature.

cards.flavor: Its venom sacs are long gone, but its crushing strength is somehow greater than ever.
cards.name: Rotting Fensnake

cards.flavor: The bat has such clarity of hearing that simple sounds become symphonies.
cards.name: Screeching Bat
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {2}{B}{B}. If you do, transform Screeching Bat.

cards.flavor: Each form she takes is an exploration of the senses.
cards.name: Stalking Vampire
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {2}{B}{B}. If you do, transform Stalking Vampire.

cards.name: Sever the Bloodline
cards.text:
Exile target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor:
"And then I realized we all have skeletons on the inside. Why wait until the bodies are dead to control them?"
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
cards.name: Skeletal Grimace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has "{B}: Regenerate this creature."

cards.flavor: "Thraben's pleas fall on deaf ears. Ours do not."
cards.name: Skirsdag High Priest
cards.text: Morbid — {T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Put a 5/5 black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if a creature died this turn.

cards.flavor: "You'd best move along, human. Our palates are far less discerning than our master's."
cards.name: Stromkirk Patrol
cards.text: Whenever Stromkirk Patrol deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: Marella was delighted. The ball had attracted so many suitors for her daughter, including that handsome stranger. She wondered where the two were now . . . .
cards.name: Tribute to Hunger
cards.text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

cards.flavor: Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.
cards.name: Typhoid Rats
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Unbreathing Horde
cards.text:
Unbreathing Horde enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each other Zombie you control and each Zombie card in your graveyard.
If Unbreathing Horde would be dealt damage, prevent that damage and remove a +1/+1 counter from it.

cards.flavor: All crave the Blessed Sleep. Few receive it.
cards.name: Unburial Rites
cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Flashback {3}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: He listens to every heartbeat, deciding which one of hundreds he will stop.
cards.name: Vampire Interloper
cards.text:
Flying
Vampire Interloper can't block.

cards.flavor:
"Do not touch a drop. Not yet. I want to watch this so-called slayer's last crisis of faith."
—Olivia Voldaren
cards.name: Victim of Night
cards.text: Destroy target non-Vampire, non-Werewolf, non-Zombie creature.

cards.flavor: Some have endured the horrors of Innistrad by becoming the worst monsters of all.
cards.name: Village Cannibals
cards.text: Whenever another Human creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Village Cannibals.

cards.flavor:
"Is it hopeless? When wave upon wave of our dead return as mindless flesh-eaters to claw upon Thraben's walls? We're too busy cutting them down to indulge ourselves in such philosophical foppery."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch
cards.name: Walking Corpse

cards.flavor: If there's anything a werewolf hates, it's a collar—especially Avacyn's Collar, the symbol of her church.
cards.name: Ancient Grudge
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: Its fiery paws make it easy to track, which is very useful when you want to go in exactly the opposite direction.
cards.name: Ashmouth Hound
cards.text: Whenever Ashmouth Hound blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Ashmouth Hound deals 1 damage to that creature.

cards.flavor: If it comes for you, die boldly or die swiftly—for die you will.
cards.name: Balefire Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Balefire Dragon deals combat damage to a player, it deals that much damage to each creature that player controls.

cards.flavor:
"Holy places are no longer sanctuary from death, and death is no longer sanctuary from anything."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
cards.name: Blasphemous Act
cards.text:
Blasphemous Act costs {1} less to cast for each creature on the battlefield.
Blasphemous Act deals 13 damage to each creature.

cards.flavor: While elder vampires select their meals with care, the newly sired frenzy at the first whiff.
cards.name: Bloodcrazed Neonate
cards.text:
Bloodcrazed Neonate attacks each turn if able.
Whenever Bloodcrazed Neonate deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Brimstone Volley
cards.text:
Brimstone Volley deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Morbid — Brimstone Volley deals 5 damage to that creature or player instead if a creature died this turn.

cards.flavor: Mist is the geists' sorrow. Wind is their pain. Fire is their vengeance.
cards.name: Burning Vengeance
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Charmbreaker Devils
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, return an instant or sorcery card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Charmbreaker Devils gets +4/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Do not flatter Fate. It did not guide you into my clutches tonight. That was all my doing."
cards.name: Crossway Vampire
cards.text: When Crossway Vampire enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Innocent thorns can fill the air with your bloodscent. Don't stray from the path."
—Elmut, crossway watcher
cards.name: Curse of Stalked Prey
cards.text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to enchanted player, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

cards.flavor: When the moon rises and the bloodlust takes hold, nothing matters but the kill.
cards.name: Curse of the Nightly Hunt
cards.text:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls attack each turn if able.

cards.flavor:
"May your veins weep, and may every vampire take notice."
—Stensian curse
cards.name: Curse of the Pierced Heart
cards.text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of the Pierced Heart deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.flavor: Her mind was quite gone, yet she spoke nothing but truth.
cards.name: Desperate Ravings
cards.text:
Draw two cards, then discard a card at random.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: A devil's hands are never idle.
cards.name: Devil's Play
cards.text:
Devil's Play deals X damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {X}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: No slinking in the dark for them, no luring whispers. They claim their prey in the speed and glory of the hunt.
cards.name: Falkenrath Marauders
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Whenever Falkenrath Marauders deals combat damage to a player, put two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor:
"The wolves no longer hunt just to feed. They kill for sport, or for some madness behind their eyes."
—Elmut, crossway watcher
cards.name: Feral Ridgewolf
cards.text:
Trample
{1}{R}: Feral Ridgewolf gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Those who only believe themselves infected with lycanthropy can be as dangerous as those who really are.
cards.name: Furor of the Bitten
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each turn if able.

cards.flavor: Innistrad pyromancers find their best raw materials in the fury of the dead.
cards.name: Geistflame
cards.text:
Geistflame deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: He scans for wolves, knowing there's one he can never anticipate.
cards.name: Hanweir Watchkeep
cards.text:
Defender
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hanweir Watchkeep.

cards.flavor: Technically he never left his post. He looks after the wolf wherever it goes.
cards.name: Bane of Hanweir
cards.text:
Bane of Hanweir attacks each turn if able.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Bane of Hanweir.

cards.flavor: Corpses destroyed by fire form the most destructive geists.
cards.name: Harvest Pyre
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Harvest Pyre, exile X cards from your graveyard.
Harvest Pyre deals X damage to target creature.

cards.name: Heretic's Punishment
cards.text: {3}{R}: Choose target creature or player, then put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.  Heretic's Punishment deals damage to that creature or player equal to the highest converted mana cost among those cards.

cards.flavor: "Oh mighty Griselbrand, Scourge of the Heedless World, gladly I consume myself for thee!"
cards.name: Infernal Plunge
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Infernal Plunge, sacrifice a creature.
Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Instigator Gang
cards.text:
Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Instigator Gang.

cards.name: Wildblood Pack
cards.text:
Trample
Attacking creatures you control get +3/+0.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Wildblood Pack.

cards.flavor: Few entrances lead to where demons and devils lurk. Unfortunately, they occasionally open new ones.
cards.name: Into the Maw of Hell
cards.text: Destroy target land. Into the Maw of Hell deals 13 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor:
"Don't be afraid when you hear the wolves howl. Be afraid when you don't hear them at all."
—Saint Trogen, the Slayer
cards.name: Kessig Wolf
cards.text: {1}{R}: Kessig Wolf gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Hold tight. I've got a surprise for them."
cards.name: Kruin Outlaw
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Kruin Outlaw.

cards.name: Terror of Kruin Pass
cards.text:
Double strike
Werewolves you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Terror of Kruin Pass.

cards.flavor: Vampires think of themselves as the indisputable nobility of Innistrad, able to do as they please. There are few who can prove them wrong.
cards.name: Night Revelers
cards.text: Night Revelers has haste as long as an opponent controls a Human.

cards.flavor: Shiny polished silver can ward off many creatures, but it attracts others.
cards.name: Nightbird's Clutches
cards.text:
Up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Past in Flames
cards.text:
Each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: The ingenuity of goblins, the depravity of demons, and the smarts of sheep.
cards.name: Pitchburn Devils
cards.text: When Pitchburn Devils dies, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: "Some lament these haunted times, but I'm a geistflame-tank-half-full kind of person."
cards.name: Rage Thrower
cards.text: Whenever another creature dies, Rage Thrower deals 2 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: "If you're not having fun, what's the point of living forever?"
cards.name: Rakish Heir
cards.text: Whenever a Vampire you control deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: "Yes, I'm alone. No, I'm not worried."
cards.name: Reckless Waif
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Reckless Waif.

cards.flavor: Before she just wanted to snatch your purse; now she'll take the whole arm.
cards.name: Merciless Predator
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Merciless Predator.

cards.flavor: Devils are demons' unearthly desires made flesh. Let loose on the world, they satisfy their mad craving for destruction in a whirlwind of chaos.
cards.name: Riot Devils

cards.flavor: When demons open a path to your front door, it's time to move.
cards.name: Rolling Temblor
cards.text:
Rolling Temblor deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
Flashback {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: Stensian villagers mourned the loss of human life. Thraben vampire slayers mourned the loss of living wood.
cards.name: Scourge of Geier Reach
cards.text: Scourge of Geier Reach gets +1/+1 for each creature your opponents control.

cards.flavor: "Within blood is life. Within life is fire. Within fire is the path to our masters' glory!"
cards.name: Skirsdag Cultist
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skirsdag Cultist deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: "A responsible king walks among his subjects."
cards.name: Stromkirk Noble
cards.text:
Stromkirk Noble can't be blocked by Humans.
Whenever Stromkirk Noble deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: "Hey lads, the moon's rising. All the better to watch him beg for mercy."
cards.name: Tormented Pariah
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Tormented Pariah.

cards.flavor: "Just look at him, groveling on all fours! What a pathetic—uh-oh."
cards.name: Rampaging Werewolf
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Rampaging Werewolf.

cards.flavor:
"I can make you dance to my tune like a puppet, your very blood eager to obey."
—Olivia Voldaren
cards.name: Traitorous Blood
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains trample and haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Many peasants secretly admire vampires' glamour and elegance—until they witness a moment of pure bloodlust.
cards.name: Vampiric Fury
cards.text: Vampire creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Each night, he abandons the trappings of civilization.
cards.name: Village Ironsmith
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Village Ironsmith.

cards.flavor: Each morning, he repairs the front door.
cards.name: Ironfang
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Ironfang.

cards.flavor:
"Living creatures seldom impress me. But I like this one."
—Uta Falkenrath
cards.name: Ambush Viper
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor: "Avacyn's protection is everywhere. From the holy church to the sacred glade, all that we see is under her blessed watch."
cards.name: Avacyn's Pilgrim
cards.text: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: The only thing it likes more than discovering a pit of bones is adding to it.
cards.name: Boneyard Wurm
cards.text: Boneyard Wurm's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"Civilization is fertilizer."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.name: Bramblecrush
cards.text: Destroy target noncreature permanent.

cards.name: Caravan Vigil
cards.text:
Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
Morbid — You may put that card onto the battlefield instead of putting it into your hand if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Creeping Renaissance
cards.text:
Choose a permanent type. Return all cards of the chosen type from your graveyard to your hand.
Flashback {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: Werewolf slayers don't know for certain how werewolves are created. So they kill all the wolves, just to be safe.
cards.name: Darkthicket Wolf
cards.text: {2}{G}: Darkthicket Wolf gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Daybreak Ranger
cards.text:
{T}: Daybreak Ranger deals 2 damage to target creature with flying.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Daybreak Ranger.

cards.name: Nightfall Predator
cards.text:
{R}, {T}: Nightfall Predator fights target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Nightfall Predator.

cards.flavor: Hopes and prayers can carry the same force as swords and torches.
cards.name: Elder of Laurels
cards.text: {3}{G}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.

cards.flavor: Wander too far into the wild and it may take you for its own.
cards.name: Essence of the Wild
cards.text: Creatures you control enter the battlefield as a copy of Essence of the Wild.

cards.flavor:
"Bury your dead deep. The boars are hungriest while the corpse is still warm."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald
cards.name: Festerhide Boar
cards.text:
Trample
Morbid — Festerhide Boar enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.

cards.flavor: Some lycanthropes wish they could abandon their weak human shapes and revel in the power of the wolf.
cards.name: Full Moon's Rise
cards.text:
Werewolf creatures you control get +1/+0 and have trample.
Sacrifice Full Moon's Rise: Regenerate all Werewolf creatures you control.

cards.name: Garruk Relentless
cards.text:
When Garruk Relentless has two or fewer loyalty counters on him, transform him.
0: Garruk Relentless deals 3 damage to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to him.
0: Put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Garruk, the Veil-Cursed
cards.text:
+1: Put a 1/1 black Wolf creature token with deathtouch onto the battlefield.
−1: Sacrifice a creature. If you do, search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
−3: Creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"What is worse than a wolf in sheep's clothing?"
—Wolfhunter's riddle
cards.name: Gatstaf Shepherd
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Gatstaf Shepherd.

cards.name: Gatstaf Howler
cards.text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Gatstaf Howler.

cards.name: Gnaw to the Bone
cards.text:
You gain 2 life for each creature card in your graveyard.
Flashback {2}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: Nature abhors a zombie.
cards.name: Grave Bramble
cards.text: Defender, protection from Zombies

cards.flavor: Seen as unsavory, the hunters were never allowed in town—until one night they vanished.
cards.name: Grizzled Outcasts
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Grizzled Outcasts.

cards.flavor: The boot prints became paw prints, and they led right back into town.
cards.name: Krallenhorde Wantons
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Krallenhorde Wantons.

cards.name: Gutter Grime
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, put a slime counter on Gutter Grime, then put a green Ooze creature token onto the battlefield with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of slime counters on Gutter Grime."

cards.flavor: "I would fear this fight, bloodsucker, were I alone."
cards.name: Hamlet Captain
cards.text: Whenever Hamlet Captain attacks or blocks, other Human creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: After werewolves slaughtered the citizenry of Hollowhenge, other creatures moved in.
cards.name: Hollowhenge Scavenger
cards.text: Morbid — When Hollowhenge Scavenger enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, you gain 5 life.

cards.flavor: "They put bars on these noble beasts and then wonder why werewolves target our towns."
cards.name: Kessig Cagebreakers
cards.text: Whenever Kessig Cagebreakers attacks, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield tapped and attacking for each creature card in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: In the forest villages of Kessig, parents feed their children wormwood and other bitter herbs, hoping to make them less palatable to things that roam the night.
cards.name: Kindercatch

cards.flavor: Animated by geists fused in its oak, it hungers for more life to add to its core.
cards.name: Lumberknot
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Lumberknot.

cards.flavor: In Gavony wishing is taken as a sign of weakness, yet the wells usually brim with silver.
cards.name: Make a Wish
cards.text: Return two cards at random from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: He can deny his true nature for only so long.
cards.name: Mayor of Avabruck
cards.text:
Other Human creatures you control get +1/+1.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Mayor of Avabruck.

cards.name: Howlpack Alpha
cards.text:
Each other creature you control that's a Werewolf or a Wolf gets +1/+1.
At the beginning of your end step, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Howlpack Alpha.

cards.flavor: The border between life and death is as thin as a layer of topsoil.
cards.name: Moldgraf Monstrosity
cards.text:
Trample
When Moldgraf Monstrosity dies, exile it, then return two creature cards at random from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Moonmist
cards.text: Transform all Humans. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures other than Werewolves and Wolves. (Only double-faced cards can be transformed.)

cards.flavor: The land knows no difference between the graves of commoners and nobles.
cards.name: Mulch
cards.text: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"Stone and thought fade into ruin. Only the wind in the leaves will endure."
—Tomb inscription
cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor:
"Pick not the rotten fruit, but neither touch the best. Leave those as an offering for our unseen guests."
—Radwick, farmer of Gatstaf
cards.name: Orchard Spirit
cards.text: Orchard Spirit can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.flavor:
"There will come a time when the only prey left will be each other."
—Ulrich of Krallenhorde Pack
cards.name: Parallel Lives
cards.text: If an effect would put one or more tokens onto the battlefield under your control, it puts twice that many of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.

cards.flavor:
"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald
cards.name: Prey Upon
cards.text: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.flavor: In the remote corners of Kessig, protection is found in secret powers unknown to the Church of Avacyn.
cards.name: Ranger's Guile
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor: Stensian vampires encourage spiders near their manors so they can rob the webs.
cards.name: Somberwald Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Morbid — Somberwald Spider enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Spider Spawning
cards.text:
Put a 1/2 green Spider creature token with reach onto the battlefield for each creature card in your graveyard.
Flashback {6}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor:
"Nobody's seen the Lady of Videns for years. Poor dear, no companions at all in that old castle."
—Yonda of Gavony
cards.name: Spidery Grasp
cards.text: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+4 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Splinterfright
cards.text:
Trample
Splinterfright's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: Visiting a shrine at the start of a journey makes the traveler more likely to finish it.
cards.name: Travel Preparations
cards.text:
Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.
Flashback {1}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: The executioner's tree in Thraben Cathedral holds the power to absolve more than the souls of the hanged.
cards.name: Tree of Redemption
cards.text:
Defender
{T}: Exchange your life total with Tree of Redemption's toughness.

cards.flavor: "With this ritual, we cast aside our fragile humanity . . ."
cards.name: Ulvenwald Mystics
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Ulvenwald Mystics.

cards.flavor: ". . . and embrace the ancient ferocity of the undying Wild."
cards.name: Ulvenwald Primordials
cards.text:
{G}: Regenerate Ulvenwald Primordials.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Ulvenwald Primordials.

cards.flavor: You can spot a werewolf-infested town by its lack of butcher shops.
cards.name: Villagers of Estwald
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Villagers of Estwald.

cards.flavor: Estwald's citizens don't dislike outsiders—they taste just fine.
cards.name: Howlpack of Estwald
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Howlpack of Estwald.

cards.flavor: "Whatever did this is near. Death reversion has not yet occurred. Be alert!"
cards.name: Woodland Sleuth
cards.text: Morbid — When Woodland Sleuth enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Before you travel the woods of Kessig, first get permission from those who died trying.
cards.name: Wreath of Geists
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: You can always tell the evil one by the dagger he's sticking in you.
cards.name: Evil Twin
cards.text: You may have Evil Twin enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield except it gains "{U}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with the same name as this creature."

cards.name: Geist of Saint Traft
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever Geist of Saint Traft attacks, put a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying onto the battlefield tapped and attacking. Exile that token at end of combat.

cards.name: Grimgrin, Corpse-Born
cards.text:
Grimgrin, Corpse-Born enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
Sacrifice another creature: Untap Grimgrin and put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever Grimgrin attacks, destroy target creature defending player controls, then put a +1/+1 counter on Grimgrin.

cards.name: Olivia Voldaren
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Olivia Voldaren deals 1 damage to another target creature. That creature becomes a Vampire in addition to its other types. Put a +1/+1 counter on Olivia Voldaren.
{3}{B}{B}: Gain control of target Vampire for as long as you control Olivia Voldaren.

cards.name: Blazing Torch
cards.text:
Equipped creature can't be blocked by Vampires or Zombies.
Equipped creature has "{T}, Sacrifice Blazing Torch: Blazing Torch deals 2 damage to target creature or player."
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Outside the safety of Thraben, there is little distinction between tool and weapon.
cards.name: Butcher's Cleaver

cards.flavor: As if anyone needed another reason to avoid dark, dank cellars.
cards.name: Cellar Door
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the bottom card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If it's a creature card, you put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: For the necro-alchemist, any puzzle can be solved with intelligence and harvested body parts.
cards.name: Cobbled Wings
cards.text:
Equipped creature has flying.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: A child's porcelain doll went missing one night, as did a pair of kitchen shears and the town magistrate.
cards.name: Creepy Doll
cards.text:
Indestructible
Whenever Creepy Doll deals combat damage to a creature, flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy that creature.

cards.flavor: It comes off as easily as your own skin.
cards.name: Demonmail Hauberk
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +4/+2.
Equip—Sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Galvanic Juggernaut
cards.text:
Galvanic Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Galvanic Juggernaut doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever another creature dies, untap Galvanic Juggernaut.

cards.flavor: The rigs were outlawed except in Nephalia, where malign spirits are as plentiful as crazed inventors.
cards.name: Geistcatcher's Rig
cards.text: When Geistcatcher's Rig enters the battlefield, you may have it deal 4 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.flavor: The bell's chime heralds the rise of the unhallowed from the grave and the fall of their victims into the earth.
cards.name: Ghoulcaller's Bell
cards.text: {T}: Each player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor: Thanks to Havengul's thriving illegal market for corpses, the shovel that interred a body during the day is usually the same one digging it out at night.
cards.name: Graveyard Shovel
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard. If it's a creature card, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Grimoire of the Dead
cards.text:
{1}, {T}, Discard a card: Put a study counter on Grimoire of the Dead.
{T}, Remove three study counters from Grimoire of the Dead and sacrifice it: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control. They're black Zombies in addition to their other colors and types.

cards.name: Inquisitor's Flail

cards.flavor: Nothing could break it but the fall.
cards.name: Manor Gargoyle
cards.text:
Defender
Manor Gargoyle has indestructible as long as it has defender.
{1}: Until end of turn, Manor Gargoyle loses defender and gains flying.

cards.flavor: It hides the face and protects the soul.
cards.name: Mask of Avacyn
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+2 and has hexproof. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Equip {3}

cards.flavor: Farmhands and priests mutter curses at the ragged thing; it unnerves more than just the crows.
cards.name: One-Eyed Scarecrow
cards.text:
Defender
Creatures with flying your opponents control get -1/-0.

cards.flavor: As sharp as its bearer's words of faith.
cards.name: Runechanter's Pike
cards.text:
Equipped creature has first strike and gets +X/+0, where X is the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard.
Equip {2}

cards.flavor: Not everyone can have a sword of blessed silver. Not everyone needs one, either.
cards.name: Sharpened Pitchfork

cards.flavor: Magical etchings turned a whittler's tool into a wolfhunter's weapon.
cards.name: Silver-Inlaid Dagger

cards.flavor: The rider set off into the eerie mist, swaddled in armor and laden with amulets.
cards.name: Traveler's Amulet
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Traveler's Amulet: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Trepanation Blade
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, defending player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a land card. The creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each card revealed this way. That player puts the revealed cards into his or her graveyard.
Equip {2}

cards.name: Witchbane Orb
cards.text:
When Witchbane Orb enters the battlefield, destroy all Curses attached to you.
You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control, including Aura spells.)

cards.name: Wooden Stake
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0.
Whenever equipped creature blocks or becomes blocked by a Vampire, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Where cathars learn to fight not only demons and vampires, but ignorance as well.
cards.name: Clifftop Retreat
cards.text:
Clifftop Retreat enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Mountain or a Plains.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"The protective wards of the church have weakened, and no one can tell us why. It's time to look to our own defenses."
—Gregel, militia leader
cards.name: Gavony Township
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{G}{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.flavor: Deserted, but not uninhabited.
cards.name: Ghost Quarter
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ghost Quarter: Destroy target land. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle his or her library.

cards.flavor: In places where the sea meets the trees, it's easy to forget the darkness that rules most of Innistrad.
cards.name: Hinterland Harbor
cards.text:
Hinterland Harbor enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Forest or an Island.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Not every church is a place of faith.
cards.name: Isolated Chapel
cards.text:
Isolated Chapel enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Plains or a Swamp.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: When a werewolf changes for the first time, that first howl is said to echo through the wilds till moonset.
cards.name: Kessig Wolf Run
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{X}{R}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +X/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Moorland Haunt
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{W}{U}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"Some see a coastal disaster. I see a fully-stocked seagraf."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
cards.name: Nephalia Drownyard
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}{B}, {T}: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"This is the price of being last in the food chain. We must keep our places of beauty hidden away instead of displayed for all to see."
—Hildin, priest of Avacyn
cards.name: Shimmering Grotto
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: The revelry ends when the supply of fresh ingenues runs dry.
cards.name: Stensia Bloodhall
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}{B}{R}, {T}: Stensia Bloodhall deals 2 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: Skirsdag cultists meet behind a waterfall's curtain and plot with demonic forces.
cards.name: Sulfur Falls
cards.text:
Sulfur Falls enters the battlefield tapped unless you control an Island or a Mountain.
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Farmers cut the trees and buried their dead. The dead rose up and killed the farmers. The trees grew back and strangled the dead.
cards.name: Woodland Cemetery
cards.text:
Woodland Cemetery enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Swamp or a Forest.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.
